Wasted valuable power and time installing this just so I could review. 

Overwatch (1) was a great game. Well balanced? Ehhh. Debatable. But it was *fun*. Never before did I care much about Competitive FPS games. It wasn't my thing. 

But when I found out I could play with friends while contributing as a support without having to be a twitch-aim crack shot? Well it caught my attention. Plus the world and characters were all so interesting.

Unfortunate that Blizzard is the way it is. So much hard work by the art dept and folks like Kaplan shat on and misused by porcine milk-drinkers.

Do, not, waste, your, time. Overwatch 2 is the shambling corpse of a once enjoyable game. It's F2P and P2W. Lies upon lies upon filthy sexually-harrassing lies.

Overwatch 2, much to the dismay of many dedicated fans, emerges as a frustrating sequel that struggles to justify its existence. While the original game set high standards for team-based shooters, its successor falls flat in several critical areas, leaving players with a sense of disappointment and missed opportunities.

Stagnant Gameplay Evolution:
Despite years of anticipation, Overwatch 2's gameplay fails to evolve in a meaningful way. The core mechanics and hero abilities are largely unchanged, making it difficult to differentiate between the two titles. This lack of innovation is especially disappointing for a sequel that was expected to push the boundaries of gameplay mechanics and introduce new ways to strategize and cooperate.

Unfulfilled Promises of New Modes:
Blizzard promised exciting new game modes, but what we received is a collection of rehashed versions of existing modes with minimal twists. Push mode, while touted as a highlight, quickly loses its appeal due to repetitive gameplay. Hero missions, marketed as a new and engaging PvE experience, amount to little more than a glorified tutorial that fails to captivate players for extended periods.

Narrative Over Gameplay:
Overwatch 2's emphasis on narrative-driven content seems to come at the expense of engaging gameplay. While exploring the lore and delving into characters' stories might be appealing to some, the heart of the Overwatch experience has always been its fast-paced, competitive multiplayer matches. The narrative focus feels forced and could alienate players who were drawn to the franchise primarily for its gameplay.

Technical Woes Persist:
Despite having the opportunity for a fresh start, Overwatch 2 carries over technical issues from its predecessor. Disruptive bugs, inconsistent hit detection, and sporadic server instability continue to plague the game, undermining the competitive experience and leading to frustration among players who expected these issues to be resolved.

Monetization Missteps:
Blizzard's approach to monetization is a glaring misstep in Overwatch 2. Transitioning to a free-to-play model is one thing, but the overwhelming push for microtransactions is another. First version of the game gave You free loot boxes when You were playing, now the only thing You get for free are some trash skins from battlepass, making it feel like players are constantly being nudged toward spending money. This shift in focus from gameplay enjoyment to cosmetic accumulation is a clear detriment to the overall experience.

Conclusion:
Overwatch 2 is a disappointing sequel that fails to build upon the foundation set by its predecessor. Its lack of meaningful gameplay innovation, unimpressive new modes, misplaced narrative focus, persistent technical problems, and aggressive microtransaction approach collectively create a lackluster experience that falls short of what fans had hoped for. Rather than elevating the franchise to new heights, Overwatch 2 stagnates and struggles to capture the magic that made the original so beloved. It's a disheartening dive into a sequel that fails to meet the standards it should have easily surpassed.

[h1]Cosas sobre Overwatch 2 que hacen que no valga la pena jugar:[/h1]

-No hay lootboxes, pero ahora que tienes que comprar un pase de batalla y skins miserables por 20 dólares.

-Las misiones semanales son las mismas toda el tiempo, a la larga se vuelve tedioso.

-No tan pulido como el primer juego como pensábamos.

-Su nuevo sistema de niveles es tan estúpido y se siente como algo para niños.

-Hicieron que el juego fuera gratuito y desequilibraron al rooster de héroes.

-Renombraron el juego con el objetivo de poder incumplir las promesas hechas para Overwatch sin enfrentar una demanda colectiva o tener que reembolsar a quien lo compró (más de 40 millones de copias).

-Tener un pase de batalla que te obliga a completarlo si quieres desbloquear a los nuevos héroes.

Esto demuestra que Overwatch ya está muriendo y Blizzard está tratando de encontrar una manera de atraer a los jugadores.

Overwatch - это прекрасно. Потрачена уйма восхитительных часов. Единственная идеальная игра с кучей интересных персонажей и красивой графикой. Идеальна для коротких сессионок, но засасывает. Жаль, конечно, что комьюнити одни нытики и токсики. Плак донат, плак баги, плак имя сменили, плак - нет баланса и. т. п. Тьфу, соплежуи. А в игре у самих руки из одного места, из каток ливают через одного и в чате скулят. Слишком чувствительные. По итогу главное - получать наслаждение от игры. А нытики, токсики, хейтеры они есть и будут. Ну, как говорится, хер им на лоб и флаг в руки. А адекватам отличных тиммейтов и сбалансированных команд. Герои не умирают! До встречи на катках.

[h1] 你说得对，但是《守望先锋2：归来》是一款由暴雪自主研发的 [/h1]
全新第一人称射击游戏。我现在每玩一周守望先锋都能赚60金币，每个月差不多240金币的收入，也就是现实生活中每个月7.2元的收入水平，换算过来31周，也就是7个月，我就可以买一个守望先锋的普通金皮，虽然守望先锋1只要1000金币升级还给箱子可以有几率开出，但是已经超越了中国绝大多数人(包括你)的水平，这便是守望先锋给我的骄傲的资本。ow没有义务给你你想得到的东西，他只是一款游戏,给你带来快乐，还要依着你的小脾气?他就算不让你玩，他也没有不对的地方，记住ow没欠你,也许我们大家还欠暴雪一句谢谢，暴雪花费大量精力和金钱制作的ow2，最后免费开放给玩家，你们居然还不知足，记住是我们选择的ow,不是ow选择的我们，觉得不好可以退游，暴雪、ow不欠我们,但是我们欠暴雪、ow一句谢谢，以及制作组两年多幸苦制作，而不是在这口诛笔伐问官方要补偿，如果你觉得我说的不对，一定是不懂2016夏天的含金量。
